snippet: Three couples filed a lawsuit Wednesday challenging a state law allowing officials to refuse to perform same-sex marriages based on their religious beliefs.
abstract: Three North Carolina couples file lawsuit challenging state law permitting officials to refuse to perform same-sex marriages based on their religious beliefs; suit charges law violates First Amendment and uses taxpayer money for religious purposes.
lead_paragraph: Three couples filed a lawsuit Wednesday challenging a state law allowing officials to refuse to perform same-sex marriages based on their religious beliefs.
